"...violence against women" says Emma Watson?? Is she nuts?? Nobody is louder and more powerful than American and British women. 
Hey Emma: Some people want to be managers, so they have to kiss ass; some want to become CEO, so they have to kiss bigger and stinkier ass; some become waitresses, janitors, mechanics, dishwashers so they have to clean messes; some want to become housewives, so they have to stand tall and strong faithful to their husband and children; some have to catch crab in Alaska so they have to put up with the weather. You wanted to live a Barbie-style life, so you had so sell some ass. 
Do you expect us to think of you as a victim in your filthy-rich lifestyle?  Everything has a price; you decided to pay it on you own free will. Nobody threatened you with a gun to get naked of spread your legs for millions to see. The only threat might've been what??? to get fired if you didn't comply?? That's all. STOP WHINING CHILDISHLY. YOU'VE LIVED THE KIND OF LIVES MOST PEOPLE ENVY. Start talking about more REAL problems and less imaginary ones.

Society clearly isn't fair, but to say you are "oppressed" is a ridiculous exaggeration.  I can agree with someone saying something like black youth are at a disadvantage, but no one is straight up oppressed.  Sure racism exists, but it isn't nearly as widespread as people like to believe.

Instead of virtue signaling and calling everyone racist.  How about we focus on policy, such as significantly increasing funding to public schools nationwide (especially inner city schools)?  How about we make universities publically funded and allow anyone with good grades access to higher education?  Really the only thing we can do is provide more opportunities for the "oppressed."  You can't legislate away racism.

Btw, if you are a white woman, you are definitely not oppressed.

Why are there even black feminist groups in England? England didn't have the same kind of racism as America. Black people weren't brought over to England in masses to work as slaves. Most black people I know in England are first or second-generation Brits and still have relatives back in Africa or the Caribbean. Their parents or grandparents came to England by CHOICE, at a progressive time when racism was not around. Chinese people have emigrated to England too, but you don't ever hear them starting up oriental feminist groups. 

Some people just have a chip on their shoulder. If they honestly feel that oppressed in a country that has welcomed them with open arms, then maybe they should go back to where they come from. And stop copying black movements in America and attempting to make them relevant in the UK.
